TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi ProjectCollection extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Encapsulates a set of related projects, their toolsets, a default set of global properties, and the loggers that should be used to build them. A global version of this class acts as the default project collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Multiple project collections can exist within an app domain. However, these must not build concurrently.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a project collection with no global properties or loggers. The project collection toolset is initialized from the configuration file and registry.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ToolsetDefinitionLocations toolsetLocations) cil managed

Docs.param: The locations from which to load toolsets.
Docs.summary: Creates a project collection with no global properties or loggers. The project collection toolset is initialized from toolsets in the given locations.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> globalProperties) cil managed

Docs.param: The default global properties to use. May be null.
Docs.summary: Instantiates a project collection with specified global properties, no loggers, and that reads toolset information from the configuration file and registry.

remarks.format: ## Remarks May throw InvalidToolsetDefinitionException.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> globalProperties, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Build.Framework.ILogger> loggers, valuetype Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ToolsetDefinitionLocations toolsetDefinitionLocations) cil managed

Docs.param: The default global properties to use. May be null.
The loggers to register. May be null.
The locations from which to load toolsets.
Docs.summary: Instantiates a project collection with specified global properties and loggers and using the specified toolset locations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks May throw InvalidToolsetDefinitionException.

MemberSignature.Value: public ProjectCollection (System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,string> globalProperties, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Build.Framework.ILogger> loggers, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Microsoft.Build.Logging.ForwardingLoggerRecord> remoteLoggers, Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ToolsetDefinitionLocations toolsetDefinitionLocations, int maxNodeCount, bool onlyLogCriticalEvents);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> globalProperties, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Build.Framework.ILogger> loggers, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Build.Logging.ForwardingLoggerRecord> remoteLoggers, valuetype Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ToolsetDefinitionLocations toolsetDefinitionLocations, int32 maxNodeCount, bool onlyLogCriticalEvents) cil managed

Docs.param: The default global properties to use. May be null.
The loggers to register. May be null and specified to any build instead.
Any remote loggers to register. May be null and specified to any build instead.
The locations from which to load toolsets.
The maximum number of nodes to use for building.
If set to true, only critical events will be logged.
Docs.summary: Creates a project collection with specified global properties, loggers, node count, and onlyLogCriticalEvents value. The project collection toolset is initialized from toolsets in the given locations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Throws InvalidProjectFileException if any of the global properties are reserved.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void AddToolset(class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Toolset toolset) cil managed

Docs.param: The toolset to be added.
Docs.summary: Adds a new toolset to the project collection. Replaces any existing toolset with the same tools version.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool ContainsToolset(string toolsVersion) cil managed

Docs.param: The tools version to search for.
Docs.summary: Determines whether a toolset is defined for the given tools version.
Docs.returns: Returns true if there is a toolset defined for the given tools version; false otherwise.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of projects currently loaded into this collection.
Docs.value: Returns the number of projects currently loaded into this collection.

Docs.summary: Gets the default tools version of this project collection.
Docs.value: Returns the default tools version of this project collection, which is always defined.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This default value is obtained from the .exe.config file, from the system registry, or if neither is present, from the hard-coded tools version "2.0".
The set method throws InvalidOperationException if a toolset with the provided tools version has not been defined.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag that determines whether <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project.MarkDirty%2A> is temporarily disabled on projects in this collection. This allows, for example, a global properties to be set without projects getting marked dirty for reevaluation as a consequence.
Docs.value: Returns a flag that determines whether is temporarily disabled.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases both managed and unmanaged resources. Called when a host no longer needs the project collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .Net 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject() before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope.”

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: If true, releases both managed and unmanaged resources; otherwise releases only unmanaged resources..
Docs.summary: Releases both managed and unmanaged resources. Called when a host no longer needs the project collection.. Shuts down any logging services that the project collection owns and releases the logger thread.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Follows the garbage disposal guidelines of .NET.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string Escape(string unescapedString) cil managed

Docs.param: The string to be converted.
Docs.summary: Converts special characters in a string to MSBuild escape format.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, "%3b" for ";". Only characters that are especially significant to MSBuild parsing are converted. Callers can use this method to make a string safe to be parsed by other methods that would otherwise expand it. Callers can also use this method to make a string safe to be written to a project file.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Execution.ProjectPropertyInstance GetGlobalProperty(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the property to be retrieved.
Docs.summary: Get any global property on the project collection that has the specified name.
Docs.returns: Returns any global property on the project collection that has the specified name; otherwise returns null.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project> GetLoadedProjects(string fullPath) cil managed

Docs.param: The path to a project file to be matched.
Docs.summary: Gets all projects whose project path matches the given path.
Docs.returns: Returns all projects whose project path matches the given path.

remarks.format: ## Remarks There may be more than one project with the given path because projects are also distinguished by global properties and/or tools version.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Toolset GetToolset(string toolsVersion) cil managed

Docs.param: The tools version to match.
Docs.summary: Get the toolset with the specified tools version.
Docs.returns: Returns the toolset with the specified tools version. Returns null if no toolset matching this tools version exists.

Docs.summary: Gets the global project collection object.
Docs.value: Returns the global project collection object. This is a singleton project collection with no global properties or loggers. Toolset information is obtained from the configuration file and registry.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Thread safe.

Docs.summary: Gets the read-only default global properties for all projects in this collection.
Docs.value: Returns the read-only default global properties for all projects in this collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection.SetGlobalProperty%2A> and <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection.RemoveGlobalProperty%2A> to add, set, and remove global properties.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an object that provides host services to tasks during builds of projects contained in the project collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, returns HostServices, which may be null.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a property that selects by default whether the targets and tasks of projects in the project collection can be built.
Docs.value: Gets or sets a property that selects by default whether the targets and tasks of projects in this project collection can be built.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Can be used for security purposes. By default, a new project has the same IsBuildEnabled setting as the parent project collection that contains it. When IsBuildEnabled is false, the Build method on this project fails.

Docs.summary: Gets all the projects currently loaded into this collection.
Docs.value: Returns all the projects currently loaded into this collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Each project has a unique combination of path, global properties, and tools version.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project LoadProject(string fileName) cil managed

Docs.param: The project file to evaluate.
Docs.summary: Evaluates a project from the source code in the given project file. The source code is evaluated with the global properties and tools version of this project collection.
Docs.returns: If an existing project in the collection has already been evaluated from the given project file, the existing project is returned. Otherwise, a new project is created, evaluated, added to the project collection, and returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .Net 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project LoadProject(class System.Xml.XmlReader xmlReader) cil managed

Docs.param: Xml reader to read project source code from.
Docs.summary: Evaluates a project from the source code read from the given XML reader. The source code is evaluated with the global properties and tools version of this project collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The project is added to this project collection when either this project or the given project root is given the full path to a project file.
In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .Net 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project LoadProject (string fileName, string toolsVersion);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project LoadProject(string fileName, string toolsVersion) cil managed

Docs.param: The project file to evaluate.
The tools version to use. May be null.
Docs.summary: Evaluates a project from the source code read from the given project file. The source code is evaluated with the global properties of this project collection and the given tools version.
Docs.returns: If an existing project in the collection has already been evaluated from the given project file, and with the given tools version, then the existing project is returned. Otherwise, a new project is created, evaluated, added to the project collection, and returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .Net 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project LoadProject (System.Xml.XmlReader xmlReader, string toolsVersion);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project LoadProject(class System.Xml.XmlReader xmlReader, string toolsVersion) cil managed

Docs.param: Xml reader to read project source code from.
The tools version to use. May be null.
Docs.summary: Evaluates a project from the source code read from the given XML reader. The source code is evaluated with the global properties of this project collection and the given tools version.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The project is added to this project collection when either this project or the given project root is given the full path to a project file.
In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .Net 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project LoadProject (string fileName, System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,string> globalProperties, string toolsVersion);

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project LoadProject(string fileName, class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> globalProperties, string toolsVersion) cil managed

Docs.param: The project file to be evaluated.
The global properties to use. May be null, in which case the containing project collection's global properties will be used.
The tools version. May be null.
Docs.summary: Evaluates a project from the source code read from the given project file. The source code is evaluated with the given global properties and tools version.
Docs.returns: If an existing project in the collection has already been evaluated from the given project file, and with the given global properties and tools version, then the existing project is returned. Otherwise, a new project is created, evaluated, added to the project collection, and returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .Net 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project LoadProject (System.Xml.XmlReader xmlReader, System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,string> globalProperties, string toolsVersion);

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project LoadProject(class System.Xml.XmlReader xmlReader, class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> globalProperties, string toolsVersion) cil managed

Docs.param: Xml reader to read project from
The global properties to use. May be null in which case the containing project collection's global properties will be used.
The tools version. May be null.
Docs.summary: Evaluates a project from the source code read from the given XML reader. The source code is evaluated with the given global properties and tools version.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The project is added to this project collection when either this project or the given project root is given the full path to a project file.
In the MSBuild versions that were delivered with .Net 4.5 and Visual Studio 12.0, you must call UnloadProject before the ProjectCollection goes out of scope.

Docs.summary: Gets all loggers that projects in this collection can use for their builds.
Docs.value: Returns all loggers that projects in this collection can use for their builds.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Loggers are added with the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection.RegisterLogger%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a switch that determines whether only critical events such as warnings and errors are logged.
Docs.value: If true, only critical events such as warnings and errors are logged; false otherwise.

Docs.summary: Event that is fired when a project is added to the ProjectRootElementCache of this project collection.
Raised when a contained by this instance is directly changed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This event is NOT raised for direct project XML changes via the construction model.

Docs.summary: Raised when state is changed on this instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This event is NOT raised for changes in individual projects.

Docs.summary: Raised when a contained by this instance is changed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This event is NOT raised for changes to global properties, or any other change that doesn't actually dirty the XML.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RegisterForwardingLoggers(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Build.Logging.ForwardingLoggerRecord> remoteLoggers) cil managed

Docs.param: The remote loggers to add. May be null.
Docs.summary: Adds the given remote loggers to the collection of remote loggers used for builds of projects in this collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RegisterLogger(class Microsoft.Build.Framework.ILogger logger) cil managed

Docs.param: The logger to add.
Docs.summary: Adds the given logger to the collection of loggers used for builds of projects in this collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the logger object is already in the collection, does nothing.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RegisterLoggers(class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class Microsoft.Build.Framework.ILogger> loggers) cil managed

Docs.param: The loggers to be added. May be null.
Docs.summary: Adds the given loggers to the collection of loggers used for builds of projects in this collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Skips any logger objects that are already in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveAllToolsets() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all toolsets from the project collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool RemoveGlobalProperty(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the default global property to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes a global property from the set of default global properties.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the global property is present before removal; false otherwise.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool RemoveToolset(string toolsVersion) cil managed

Docs.param: The toolset to be removed.
Docs.summary: Removes a toolset from the project collection.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the toolset is present before removal; false otherwise.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetGlobalProperty (string name, string value);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetGlobalProperty(string name, string value) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the default global property to be added or set.
The new value of the default global property.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of a property in the default set of global properties.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If no matching property is found, the property is created and initialized with the given value.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag the determines whether ReevaluateIfNecessary is temporarily disabled on projects in this collection. This is useful when the host expects to make a number of reads and writes to projects, and wants to temporarily sacrifice correctness for performance.
Docs.value: Returns a flag the determines whether ReevaluateIfNecessary is temporarily disabled.

Docs.summary: Gets the locations used to find the toolsets.
Docs.value: Returns the locations used to find the toolsets.

Docs.summary: Gets the toolsets available to this project collection.
Docs.value: Returns the toolsets available to this project collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool TryUnloadProject(class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement projectRootElement) cil managed

Docs.param: The root element of the project to unload.
Docs.summary: Attempts to remove a project from the collection.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the project was unloaded.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string Unescape(string escapedString) cil managed

Docs.param: The string to be converted.
Docs.summary: Converts escaped characters in a string to MSBuild characters with special meaning.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For example, "%3b" is converted to ";".

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void UnloadAllProjects() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all projects in this project collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The host should call this method when it no longer needs the projects.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void UnloadProject(class Microsoft.Build.Construction.ProjectRootElement projectRootElement) cil managed

Docs.param: The project root element to unload.
Docs.summary: Removes a project root element from the project root cache.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is useful for the case where the host knows that all projects using this root element have been removed, and that any unsaved changes should be discarded.

Docs.exception: Thrown if the project root element to unload is still in use by a loaded project or its imports.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void UnloadProject(class Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.Project project) cil managed

Docs.param: The project to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes the given project from the project collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The host should call this method when it no longer needs the project.
Throws InvalidOperationException if the given project is not present in the project collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void UnregisterAllLoggers() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all loggers from the collection of loggers used by project builds in this collection.
Gets the file version of the assembly file that contains the MSBuild engine.
Docs.value: Returns the file version of the assembly file that contains the MSBuild engine.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is the Windows file version (specifically the value of the ProductVersion resource), which is not necessarily the assembly version. To obtain the assembly version, use Constants.AssemblyVersion.
See also the <xref:Microsoft.Build.Evaluation.ProjectCollection.ToolsetsVersion%2A>.
